device-node: Enable Werror compiler flag

To remove the warnning messages and latent bugs

Change-Id: I48ef0ea78dbd93bef5ebf44ac9d519822e955681

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am just curious how much RAM can be saved by splitting code into two libraries and using dlopen() to load one of them. I am afraid there will be more code, which will load slower.


Regarding the commit message, please use capital letters to begin sentences. Please rearrange the paragraph so the lines are only a little shorter than 72 characters.

Please read the following pages and follow the guidelines for writing
commit message contained therein.

* http://bit.ly/goodcommitmessages
* http://who-t.blogspot.com/2009/12/on-commit-messages.html
* http://dep.debian.net/deps/dep3/
* https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Talk:Packaging/Guidelines
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I'm for Lukasz comment. So I do not seperate device-plugin module from libdevice-node.
Thank you for your comments.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Not match between commit-msg and patch code.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)
Uploaded patch set 4.
Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 4: Verified+1
Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: device-node: Replace system() with the combination of fork/exec
commitMessage:
device-node: Replace system() with the combination of fork/exec

As per man page, it cautions against using system() in a program.
It can make a problem like a ruin of system intergrity
by strange values for some environment variables.

Change-Id: I5d77931c3fbb5fd1851219aaf8e8578d8ed9d255
Signed-off-by: jy910.yun <jy910.yun@samsung.com>

subject: Clean up udev and Smack rules
commitMessage:
Clean up udev and Smack rules

Smack rules for device nodes should be applied in the udev package.
Security team should audit permissions for device nodes that are
needed to be changed that were being kept in this package (but again
should be done in the udev package as there were a broad grouping of
devices that may even conflict with default udev rules).

This change is likely a breaking change and will need corresponding
changes to other packages (including udev rules and manifest).

Change-Id: I509035ace21163e24231e825f44a9f96a988c47e
Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified; Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

After discussion with William this is the right thing to do. Also with the change to the three domain model coming this package needs to be thought out as it will also need to be a separate package to allow verticals to fork based on needs.
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: TIVI-1050: set several Smack rules to floor in 95-devices.rules
commitMessage:
TIVI-1050: set several Smack rules to floor in 95-devices.rules

Now that the systemd patch is integrated that supports setting Smack
labels for device nodes (via udev), several device nodes have rules set
that are breaking sound applications (e.g. Pulseaudio).

For the moment, we will set the default labels to "_" (floor), and we
will adjust them when the domain architecture has been settled.

Change-Id: Ie0098026ff8d0917d54ee1f367c20feda8d3b4e7
